conclusion: Determine the resultant Ampere force on the trapezoidal frame in a magnetic field.
Calculate total resistance R using resistivity, length, and cross-sectional area.
Total length of wire is 3L + ad.
Calculate ad as 2L using horizontal projections.
Current I in the circuit is ES/(5ρL).
Ampere force on a segment is F = IlB sin(θ).
Force on ab is ESB√3/(10ρ) directed out of the plane.
Force on cd is ESB√3/(10ρ) directed out of the plane.
Force on ad is 2ESB/(5ρ) directed into the plane.
Resultant force from ab and cd is ESB√3/(5ρ) out of the plane.
Resultant force is ESB(√3 - 2)/(5ρ) into the plane.
Direction of resultant force is into the plane.
Magnitude and direction of resultant Ampere force is ESB(2 - √3)/(5ρ) into the plane.
